content: Known as the "Father of Microbiology," this Dutch scientist was the first person to observe bacteria and protozoa using a microscope he built himself.

Antonie van Leeuwenhoek is often referred to as the "Father of Microbiology." He was a Dutch scientist who made significant contributions to the field by being the first person to observe bacteria and protozoa using microscopes that he designed and built himself. His work laid the foundation for microbiology and greatly expanded our understanding of the microscopic world.
